text:
Lovely place for some Beautiful pictures.  Idyllic.

No public transport brings you here,  so you will have to walk or cycle or perhaps take a cab.

The walkway is too narrow for comfort,  since you have to watch out for cyclists. Most of the cyclists i met on this route seemed polite though.

I stopped over for about 10 minutes while on my journey to Yishun dam

On 21st August 2020, I ride the bicycle from my place at Buangkok to Punggol Waterways then to Punggol Timor Island. It took me about 45mins.
It was early morning about 8am at Punggol Timor Island, I was simply amazed by the scenery. You can see tall casuarina trees stretching along the coastline.
No wonder, newly-wed couples like to come here to take pictures.

My first time to visit last Oct 24..amazing place so relaxing views...How to get here? Take bus 103 from North City Point Bus interchange and alight bef Shell aviation bus top then walkthrough the Seletar North Link bridge this spot is around 15 to 20 mins walk for there's no other bus stop nearby in here or u can cycle also. Another options take bus 84 from  Punggol bus interchange and alight at the bus stop of Marina Country Club Punggol...Then walk back to the main road follow the path going to S11 dormitories further more u can see the sign North Seletar link and this spot on the lefsides.
